en.av_c1: When we start the partition function, pivot value 60 has been moved to the right most position.
en.av_c2: The left and right bounds are set to positions 0 and 8, respectively
en.av_c3: Now move left bound rightward as long as it is at a value less than 60. Since it starts on 76 which is greater than 60, there is no movement of the left bound at this time.
en.av_c4: Likewise, the right bound starts at a value less than 60, so it does not move.
en.av_c5: Swap the values at the bounds.
en.av_c6: Now move the left bound to the right as long as it is at a value less than the pivot.
en.av_c8: Now we are at 88, which is greater than or equal to 60.
en.av_c9: Now we move the right bound to the left until it reaches a value less than 60.
en.av_c10: Now the right bound is at 42, which is less than 60.
en.av_c12: Once again, move the left bound to the right.
en.av_c13: Left bound is at 85, which is bigger than the pivot value.
en.av_c14: Move the right bound to the left until we reach a value that is smaller than 60.
en.av_c15: Note that the right bound has crossed over the left bound. So partition is done.
en.av_c16: Since the left bound has reached position 4, this is the value returned by the partition function.
